1: 1. You hit the nail right on the head. Too bad your parents took it literally.
2: 2. Is part 2 of your argument coming out soon or is that it?
3: 3. The fact that someone wakes up to your face in the morning should be alarming. And yes, I’m referring to the mirror as well.
4: 4. Don’t worry. Everyone makes mistakes. Your parents, for one.
5: 5. No amount of self-editing can fix the massive failure your autobiography would be.
6: 6. Earth has a population of over 7 billion, and I had to meet the biggest loser imaginable.
7: 7. A corpse is better company than you.
8: 8. The series of mental backflips I had to do to try and understand your point should have broken my neck.
9: 9. Your ignorance makes my racist uncle look like Albert Einstein.
10: 10. You’re the corner piece to an unsolvable puzzle: everyone looks right past you.
11: 11. You’re the type of person that uses their 3rd grade research paper as a resume booster.
12: 12. Your skin is glowing, but I think it’s from the radiation emanating from your toxic ass personality.
13: 13. I’ve never had many life goals. I’m just really grateful I’m not you.
14: 14. I would like some tips on how to clear my mind from someone with nothing meaningful to contribute. Care to help?
15: 15. Your absence would affect me greatly. I’d finally get some peace and quiet.
16: 16. Louie Armstrong would have never released “What a Wonderful World” had he met you.
17: 17. You’re not simply a drama queen. You’re the whole royal family.
18: 18. Some people hatch into beautiful butterflies. Some people hatch into whatever the hell you are.
19: 19. Has anyone ever tried to smack some sense into you? Allow me to be the first one.
20: 20. Funny, I don’t remember you raising your hand. I’m going to call on someone else.
21: 1. When they said grow a pair, they didn’t mean for you to have kids.
22: 2. You hear that? It’s the sound of me not caring.
23: 3. I’m not going to repeat myself, but I’m also glad to do anything that prevents you from talking.
24: 4. I applaud your effort, but I think I’m the only one in the audience. And I’m leaving early.
25: 5. This is a lose-lose situation for me. I lose my valuable time and any semblance of compassion I had left.
26: 6. You’re an unscented candle in a store full of beautiful fragrances.
27: 7. You are the architect of your life. Unfortunately, the blueprints are messy, written in Mandarin, and waterlogged beyond all recognition. Good luck.
28: 8. I like you just the way you are: uninspiring, uninteresting, and dreadfully unfunny.
29: 9. All mistakes are fixable, yet you aren’t.
30: 10. Did I hurt your ego? Do you want a kissy on your boo-boo?
31: 11. Your brain is working overtime today. You better pay it extra.
32: 12. I’d tell you to blow your brains out, but I’m pretty certain there’s nothing there.
33: 13. The Department of Homeland Security added your existence to the list of “Natural Disasters.”
34: 14. Being a dick to me won’t make yours bigger.
35: 15. Ditch the outfit. You’re enough of an asshat as it is.
36: 16. I don’t want to rain on your parade. I want a typhoon.
37: 17. The amount of meaningful things you’ve done in your life wouldn’t be enough to fill a single page.
38: 18. I’d hate to come across a universe where you’re funny.
39: 19. I’d spell it out for you, but that’s assuming you know your ABC’s
40: 20. Swallow your pride and your tongue while you’re at it.
41: 1. You should come with a warning label.
42: 2. They say our brains don’t stop developing until we reach 25; looks like yours stopped a bit early.
43: 3. Good job. You almost reached a level of coherency resembling my newborn son.
44: 4. Large and in charge isn’t your excuse to be a fat asshole.
45: 5. I can’t think of anything to celebrate on your birthday except you being closer to death.
46: 6. It got a little chillier in here once I realized you were a cold-hearted bitch.
47: 7. Are you at a loss for words, or did you exhaust your entire vocabulary?
48: 8. I don’t have any trash to take out today, but I volunteer you as tribute.
49: 9. I understand everything you said. I’m choosing to ignore you.
50: 10. I gave out all my trophies a while ago, but here’s a participation award.
51: 11. When God made you, you must have been on the bottom of his “to-do” list.
52: 12. Aww, don’t worry, you are wanted…wanted for several accounts of perjury.
53: 13. I didn’t put garlic over my door because I think you’re a vampire. It just smells much better than you.
54: 14. Every cloud has a silver lining. I’m still trying to figure out yours.
55: 15. You’ve got something on your face. No, not there—everywhere.
56: 16. I have a present for you. I present to you: absolutely fucking nothing.
57: 17. My heart was beating fast when I saw you walk in. I thought you were the monster under my bed.
58: 18. If you ever cross my mind, I’ll make sure it’s a busy intersection.
59: 19. Are all your friends this stupid as well? Maybe we can invite them over and, together, you’d constitute one working brain cell.
60: 20. I must have been imagining things. For a second there, I thought you made a valid point.
61: 1. You seem to have a lot on your mind… a lot of bullshit.
62: 2. You’re the reason the divorce rate is so high.
63: 3. “Spending some time” would imply I’d spend anything on your ungrateful ass.
64: 4. Row, row, row your boat gently down a raging fucking waterfall.
65: 5. You must be magic because I suddenly don’t give a shit anymore!
66: 6. Usually my rule is “3 strikes and you’re out,” but you were out of my mind as soon as you started spewing your bullshit.
67: 7. Glad I could be of assistance. Allow me to assist you in never walking again.
68: 8. The song “Army of One” is an ode to your loneliness.
69: 9. I clean up germs all day, but no matter how hard I scrub, you’re still here.
70: 10. I’m surprised your teeth aren’t brown from all the shit talking you do.
71: 11. The hardest pill to swallow is knowing nothing is as lethal as your personality.
72: 12. You’re like my fridge: always full of yourself yet offering an abundance of empty calories.
73: 13. There are so many paths in life. Why didn’t you choose the dark alleyway?
74: 14. No matter how many shmucks I meet in my life, I can always trust you to be the absolute worst.
75: 15. Did God make you with his eyes closed?
76: 16. What did you want to be when you grew up? A pain in the ass?
77: 17. Don’t place your self-worth in other’s hands. That being said, allow me to redirect you to the discount section. I found a spot for you.
78: 18. Journey to the Center of the Earth was based on the quest to find where your head went after you shoved it up your own asshole.
79: 19. A balloon full of piss makes a bigger splash than your entire meaningless existence will on this planet.
80: 20. The truth will set you free. You suck. Ok, you’re free to go.
81: 1. The 0.01% of germs are afraid of contracting stupidity from you.
82: 2. Are you normally this obnoxious, or is there some class you took?
83: 3. There was some terrible traffic accident on the news today. I was hoping that it was you.
84: 4. It takes me a lot of effort to smile when you’re around.
85: 5. I didn’t think it was possible to give me more reasons to hate you until today.
86: 6. I wanted to live life without many regrets. Then I met you.
87: 7. Last week’s test was on shapes and colors, but it appears like you might have to revisit that after today’s conversation.
88: 8. Break a leg. No, seriously, break a leg.
89: 9. How awful. I was just imagining the day of your birth in my head.
90: 10. I’d have hired an exterminator if I knew you were gonna bug the shit out of me.
91: 1. A glowstick has a brighter future than you. Lasts longer in bed, too.
92: 2. I wrote something nice for you in invisible ink. Sorry, it must have washed off.
93: 3. The only person falling for you is blind.
94: 4. You can be anything you want…except good looking.
95: 5. Spontaneity is the spice of life, and you’re as plain as they come.
96: 6. I really enjoy the silence of your company. Can you stop talking more often?
97: 7. I’ve never been a great cook, but I still know how to roast your ass.
98: 8. You’re lucky intelligence isn’t measured in negative numbers.
99: 9. You have a lot in common with the wart on my toe: You’re hard to get rid of, and I can’t stand the pain you bring me daily.
100: 10. Listen to your doubts. I think they’re onto something.
